refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect2.title: struct SchroFrame
struct SchroFrameData
enum SchroFrameFormat
schro_frame_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object. The created frame is uninitialized and has no data storage associated with it. The caller must fill in the required information.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_and_alloc ()
refsect2.programlisting: SchroFrame * schro_frame_new_and_alloc (SchroMemoryDomain *domain, SchroFrameFormat format, int width, int height);
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size and format.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_from_data_AYUV ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size using the data pointed to by data. The data must be in AYUV format. The data must remain for the lifetime of the SchroFrame object. It is recommended to use schro_frame_set_free_callback() for notification when the data is no longer needed.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_from_data_I420 ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size using the data pointed to by data. The data must be in I420 format. The data must remain for the lifetime of the SchroFrame object. It is recommended to use schro_frame_set_free_callback() for notification when the data is no longer needed.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_from_data_YUY2 ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size using the data pointed to by data. The data must be in YUY2 format. The data must remain for the lifetime of the SchroFrame object. It is recommended to use schro_frame_set_free_callback() for notification when the data is no longer needed.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_dup ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the same dimensions and format as frame, and copies the data from the frame to the new object.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increases the reference count of frame.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decreases the reference count of frame. If the new reference count is 0, the frame is freed. If a frame free callback was set, this function is called.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_set_free_callback ()
refsect2.para: Sets a function that will be called when the object reference count drops to zero and the object is freed.

listitem.simpara: the function to call when the frame is freed

refsect2.title: schro_frame_clone ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the same dimensions and format as frame. This function leaves the data in the new object uninitialized.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_data_get_codeblock ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_frame_data_get_codeblock (SchroFrameData *dest, SchroFrameData *src, int x, int y, int horiz_codeblocks, int vert_codeblocks);

refsect2.title: schro_frame_get_metric ()
refsect2.programlisting: int schro_frame_get_metric (SchroFrame *frame1, int x1, int y1, SchroFrame *frame2, int x2, int y2);

refsect2.title: schro_frame_get_subdata ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_frame_get_subdata (SchroFrame *frame, SchroFrameData *fd, int comp, int x, int y);

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_from_data_UYVY ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size using the data pointed to by data. The data must be in UYVY format. The data must remain for the lifetime of the SchroFrame object. It is recommended to use schro_frame_set_free_callback() for notification when the data is no longer needed.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_new_from_data_YV12 ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new SchroFrame object with the requested size using the data pointed to by data. The data must be in YV12 format. The data must remain for the lifetime of the SchroFrame object. It is recommended to use schro_frame_set_free_callback() for notification when the data is no longer needed.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_convert ()
refsect2.para: Copies data from the source frame to the destination frame, converting formats if necessary. Only a few conversions are supported.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_add ()
refsect2.para: Adds data from the source frame to the destination frame. The frames must have the same chroma subsampling, and only a few combinations of bit depths are supported.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_subtract ()
refsect2.para: Subtracts data from the source frame to the destination frame. The frames must have the same chroma subsampling, and only a few combinations of bit depths are supported.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_shift_left ()
refsect2.para: Shifts each value in frame to the left by shift bits. This operation happens in-place.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_shift_right ()
refsect2.para: Shifts each value in frame to the right by shift bits. This operation happens in-place.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_edge_extend ()
refsect2.para: Extends the edges of the subpicture defined from 0,0 to width,height to the size of frame.

refsect2.title: schro_frame_zero_extend ()
schro_frame_iwt_transform ()
refsect2.para: Performs an in-place integer wavelet transform on frame. The frame must have a bit depth of 16.

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_block_fast_precN ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_upsampled_frame_get_block_fast_precN (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y, int prec, SchroFrameData *dest, SchroFrameData *fd);

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_block_precN ()
refsect2.programlisting: void schro_upsampled_frame_get_block_precN (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y, int prec, SchroFrameData *dest);

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec0 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec0 (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y);

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec1 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec1 (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y);

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec3 ()
refsect2.programlisting: int schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_prec3 (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y);

refsect2.title: schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_precN ()
refsect2.programlisting: int schro_upsampled_frame_get_pixel_precN (SchroUpsampledFrame *upframe, int k, int x, int y, int mv_precision);
